posts.message: Ruby or Python for job automation and System administration Tasks. Anyone recommend Go-lang ?

I'm trying to make a simple (Check & un-check All) in a grid view with "AngularJS" but all examples that i found depends on ng-repeat which not my case.

the issue is i used (ng-checked) to achieve my target but when the master checkbox is checked the child checkboxes not firing onchange event so i couldn't complete my task to make some changes depend on whether the child checkbox is checked or not

posts.message:
For the network geeks out there, I get internet in my house via some mysterious wireless device on my roof that connects to an internet provider about 3 Kms away.

Anyway, those people are seriously incompetent, and I never run out of internet problems on a daily basis. The latest issues is randomly getting 404 errors. The issue is completely random, not related to a certain site or a certain time.

I tried changing my DNS server to 8.8.8.8 to no effect. The issue only goes away when I use an SSH tunnel to a USA server, which of course is too slow for daily usage.

I appreciate any help on this matter, since my incompetent ISP do not even know where to start looking.

One of the not-very-famous tools that I find indispensable in my daily workflow, on Linux I use Klipper, parcelite or even Glipper but on Windows it must be a third-party tool and Ditto does the job very well.

I use Windows+V to invoke it but this stopped working since Windows 8, so I switched to Alt+Shift+V

posts.message: Record and share your terminal sessions, the right way :D
posts.caption: asciinema.org
posts.description: Any time you see a command you'd like to try in your own terminal just pause the player and copy-paste the content you want. It's just a text after all!

posts.message:
Hi Guys,
I'm a lone developer from Egypt. My new game "Space Platform" just get approved by Apple and is ready for a 24 June release. Hope you like the preview. If you have any questions, I'll be happy to answer them. Your support and backing is very important. cheers :-)
posts.description:
Hi,
Here is The App Preview for "Space Platform". The game is done and in the submission process. Scheduled release around mid June. I'm really looking forward to your feedback and hope you'll enjoy the game when it comes out. Support me by sharing and telling your friends. Peace.
